inclusion.criterion: Anticipated need for intensive care 3 days or longer
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients condition allowing enteral nutrition to be started within 24 h from ICU
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Known positive test for Clostridium difficile within the last week
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Known ulcers in the mouth, oropharynx, esophagus and stomach
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Pancreatitis as admission diagnosis at the hospital or at the ICU
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 60-year-old woman admitted to the stroke department with a recent history of a second course of intravenous antibiotics for aspiration pneumonia. She is febrile and complained of abdominal pain and diarrhea (bowel movements eight times in 3 hours, large volumes of greenish, liquid stool each time).
